metadata.title: CVE-2013-20001 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in OpenZFS through 2.0.3. When an NFS share isexported to IPv6 addresses via the sharenfs feature, there is a silentfailure to parse the IPv6 address data, and access is allowed to everyone.IPv6 restrictions from the configuration are not applied.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-20001` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnvpair3linux - 2.2.0~rc3-0ubuntu4
libpam-zfs - 2.2.0~rc3-0ubuntu4
libuutil3linux - 2.2.0~rc3-0ubuntu4
libzfs4linux - 2.2.0~rc3-0ubuntu4
libzfsbootenv1linux - 2.2.0~rc3-0ubuntu4
libzpool5linux - 2.2.0~rc3-0ubuntu4
python3-pyzfs - 2.2.0~rc3-0ubuntu4
zfs-dkms - 2.2.0~rc3-0ubuntu4
zfs-dracut - 2.2.0~rc3-0ubuntu4
zfs-initramfs - 2.2.0~rc3-0ubuntu4
zfs-test - 2.2.0~rc3-0ubuntu4
zfs-zed - 2.2.0~rc3-0ubuntu4
zfsutils-linux - 2.2.0~rc3-0ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zfs-linux package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.0~rc3-0ubuntu4').
